image.altText: A woman wearing a police hat

items.synopsis: Senior NSW Police officers deny losing control of the escalating drug wars across Sydney but admit they are up against a "wall of silence". Five people have been shot in five days — two of them fatally.

title.children: Police deny losing control of drug war as man dies days after Sydney car ambush

image.altText: A young blonde girl smiles at the camera

items.synopsis: Tasmania Police have charged a 36-year-old man with the murder of teenager Shyanne-Lee Tatnell, after human remains were found in bushland in Tasmania's north-east

title.children: Tasmania Police charge man with murder of teenager Shyanne-Lee Tatnell

image.altText: A close up shot of Daniel Andrews face during a media conference.

items.synopsis: A proposal to host a regional Commonwealth Games at almost half the cost of the eventual government plan was provided to senior bureaucrats in 2021.

title.children: Victorian government ignored plan to host a cheaper Commonwealth Games

image.altText: An overhead picture of the ski slopes at Thredbo with no people around.

items.synopsis: Police say bystanders commenced CPR after the 73-year-old crashed at the edge of the ski run, but he died at the scene.

title.children: Man believed to have crashed into pole dies while skiing at Thredbo

image.altText: A woman looks up at a large transmission tower.

items.synopsis: New figures from the Australian Energy Market Operator show wholesale power prices have fallen by nearly 60 per cent in the past year, while households brace for an increase of at least 20 per cent to their power bill.

title.children: Why are power bills rising while wholesale electricity prices are falling? It's because of 'a horrible coincidence'

image.altText: a composite image of two men one wearing glasses the other wearing a cap backwards looking at the camera

items.synopsis: A Sydney fisherman finds the body of Andrew Findlay who was thrown overboard in a boat crash last week which also killed art dealer Tim Klingender.

title.children: Body of tech entrepreneur found in Sydney Harbour a week after fishing boat crash

image.altText: Woman smiling on airbike

items.synopsis: Incontinence is a health issue affecting one in four Australians, but shame and embarrassment often stop people from seeking help, writes Caitlyn Davey.

title.children: A bladder condition nearly destroyed my kidneys and made me realise we need to talk about incontinence

image.altText: Middle aged man close up of his face in a car, photographer in background

items.synopsis: Lawyers for Tim Mathieson, the former partner of Julia Gillard, say he will plead guilty to a charge of sexual assault during a hearing in the Melbourne Magistrates' Court.

title.children: Tim Mathieson, former partner of Julia Gillard, to plead guilty to sexual assault charge

image.altText: A black and white photo of five men with caps perched on a section of the bridge

items.synopsis: Despite receiving a certificate of bravery at the time, George Manly Killen's life-saving actions have been left out of the history books, but his descendants want to change that with a plaque commemorating the historic deed.

title.children: Family wants to honour man 'who put his life on the line for a mate' in Sydney Harbour Bridge fall

image.altText: Greg Jenkins 1

items.synopsis: The Reserve Bank is hiking interest rates — and hitting borrowers — to fight high inflation, but data suggests the fight is being undermined by big-spending baby boomers.

title.children: 'We're not paying the price': The boomers boosting inflation as the RBA lifts rates to fight it

image.altText: Woman with shaved head in floral dress sings into microphone

items.synopsis: From the moment she rocketed to international stardom with her rendition of Prince's Nothing Compares 2 U, Sinéad O'Connor attracted plenty of public attention.

title.children: Ripping the pope, torching Madonna: The many controversies of Sinéad O'Connor's career

image.altText: A woman standing on an old damage bridge. She is touching the bridge and looking at damage on the trusses. The bridge is closed.

items.synopsis: Brig O'Johnstone Bridge closed to traffic a fortnight ago after an accident. The government says it will be another week before a repair plan and timeline can be finalised.

title.children: This bridge connects Sarah with her community. But now it's broken, dividing the town

image.altText: a woman looking left

items.synopsis: The police minister says detectives are working around the clock to investigate a series of shootings this week, as the NSW opposition claims the government has "lost control" of the streets.

title.children: 'Lost control' of crime in Sydney: Spate of shootings puts pressure on NSW government

image.altText: a man talking

items.synopsis: The regulator argued the 8-point font on the former MP's election posters were too small to read from a distance.

title.children: 'This case was a disgrace from the start': Craig Kelly wins court battle over font size on his election posters

image.altText: Kirrawee nursing home Joan Hobbs

items.synopsis: The family of Joan Hobbs have called for better staffing after the 89-year-old woman was attacked by a fellow dementia patient with a walking frame.

title.children: Elderly woman allegedly bashed to death by fellow dementia patient in Sydney nursing home

image.altText: A woman wearing sunglasses photographed through a glass window.

items.synopsis: A Supreme Court trial has been told Gina Rinehart has known since 1983 that her father's former business partner, Peter Wright, could have a legal claim to royalties from the Hope Downs mine, as her children's claim was labelled "a distraction".

title.children: Personal letters, legal docs and even a telex suggests Gina Rinehart knew to share mining fortune, court hears

image.altText: Image of couple in front of cancelled and sign and Metricon label

items.synopsis: Metricon, the biggest home builder in the country, has told some customers to pay painfully higher prices or risk losing their new homes and deposits in a contract nightmare affecting home owners.

title.children: Building giant tells buyers to pay hundreds of thousands extra or lose homes and deposits

image.altText: A new underground metro railway line will be built between Parramatta and the Sydney CBD.

items.synopsis: It was billed as Australia's biggest public transport project but is the promise of four metro lines for Sydney just a pipe dream? Here's how the project began, the hurdles it's faced and where it's up to now.

title.children: Sydney's metro mayhem — what's gone wrong?

image.altText: Chris Hipkins and Anthony Albanese standing at podiums at a press conference.

items.synopsis: Anthony Albanese insists Australia's ties with New Zealand will not suffer if there is a change of government in Wellington, as the man firming to replace incumbent Chris Hipkins talks up his relationship with Australia's prime minister.

title.children: As Albanese tours NZ with PM Hipkins, he takes a brief aside with nation's next possible leader

image.altText: A woman screams after scoring a goal.

items.synopsis: Scores are tied at half-time in Australia's crucial World Cup clash in Brisbane, after Nigeria answered a late Emily van Egmond goal. Follow the match live.

title.children: Nigeria levels things up just minutes after Matildas open the scoring

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: What a response from Nigeria. In what was the final act of the first half, they marched forward with number 15 Rasheedat Ajibade. Her cross inside the box was deflected by Australia's Ellie Carpenter, and the rebound landed at the feet of Nigeria's goal scorer Uchenna Kanu. Kanu struck low and to the left of goalkeeper Mackenzie Arnold, who could not get down.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 45+6: GOAL NIGERIA

children.content: In what was the final act of the first half, they marched forward with number 15 Rasheedat Ajibade.
Her cross inside the box was deflected by Australia's Ellie Carpenter, and the rebound landed at the feet of Nigeria's goal scorer Uchenna Kanu.
Kanu struck low and to the left of goalkeeper Mackenzie Arnold, who could not get down.

liveBlogPostPrepared.plaintext: Brilliant from the Matildas. They have been searching for that goal for the past 20 minutes. A poor goal kick from Nigeria was well handled by Australia's Katrina Gorry, who knocked it to Foord. Foord was cool, passing the perfect ball behind the defence to Emily van Egmond who gave Australia a 1-0 lead.
liveBlogPostPrepared.title: 45+1: GOAL MATILDAS

children.content: They have been searching for that goal for the past 20 minutes.
A poor goal kick from Nigeria was well handled by Australia's
Katrina Gorry, who knocked it to Foord.
Foord was cool, passing the perfect ball behind the defence to
Emily van Egmond who gave Australia a 1-0 lead.

image.altText: Bald man in army greens holding a gun in front of white wall.

items.synopsis: One of the top leaders in the Russian Army, Sergei Surovikin, has not been seen since the mutiny against the Kremlin last month. At first it seems odd, but it turns out General Surovikin is not who he seems.

title.children: Russian 'General Armageddon' Sergei Surovikin is missing — is he 'resting' or Resting In Peace?

image.altText: A composite image of Emmanuel Macron holding two clenched fists and Antony Blinken looking stoic

items.synopsis: The United States says "the door is open" for New Zealand to join AUKUS, as three of the world's most influential leaders continue their tour of the Pacific region.

title.children: Macron warns of 'new imperialism' in Pacific, as Blinken says 'door is open' for NZ to join AUKUS

image.altText: A composite image of Kevin Spacey clutching an Oscar and a court sketch

items.synopsis: The trial against Kevin Spacey was a strange mix of celebrity witnesses, tearful testimony and graphic allegations of sexual violence. WARNING: Some readers may find details in this story distressing.

title.children: Kevin Spacey was one of the biggest names hit by #MeToo. Here's why a London court cleared him

image.altText: Young man stands facing away from camera wearing a hat

items.synopsis: A children's magistrate in Port Kembla has described this innovative mentoring program as "remarkable" and "transformative" for young people who were once on a bleak path. But its future is under threat.

title.children: This 'extraordinary' program halting domestic violence in its tracks is about to run out of money

image.altText: A blury close up photo of the face of a man wearing a hat.

items.synopsis: Adam Bidner is sentenced for reversing his four-wheel drive into Shane Mears in July 2020, in what a supreme court judge has described as a "cowardly" and "grave" act.

title.children: Man who ran down fellow scrap-metal forager at Hunter Valley tip jailed for more than 24 years

image.altText: A composite image of Sinead O'Conner and Prince

items.synopsis: Despite being Sinéad O'Connor's most recognisable song, Nothing Compares 2 U originally came from the pen of Prince.

title.children: Nothing Compares 2 U: How the song of 1990 went from Prince to Sinéad and back again

image.altText: Sinead O'connor wearing a priests black outfit with a cross holding a microphone and smiling

items.synopsis: Irish singer-songwriter Sinéad O'Connor, who became a superstar in her mid-20s, dies at 56.

title.children: Sinéad O'Connor, who topped charts in the 90s, dies aged 56

image.altText: A woman in a green top stands against a stone wall.

items.synopsis: Sarab was 11 when ISIS militants attacked her village and sold her into slavery. Five years later, she had been given to six different men. Now, she wants justice, writes Stephanie March.

title.children: She was abducted and sold into slavery at 11. Now Sarab wants justice

image.altText: A couple in their backyard.

items.synopsis: Although it's been in planning for more than 20 years, a dozen families on the Sunshine Coast are reeling after the shock discovery that their homes will be acquired for a major new road and rail project, the Mooloolah River Interchange.

title.children: Residents shocked by 'railway through our back patio' as homes to be bulldozed for transport corridor

image.altText: A man points to a shrub on fire, with a crowd of onlookers listening.

items.synopsis: Insurance, approvals, and understanding within government have been hampering efforts to ramp up cultural burning, but a large volume of requests from private landholders is forcing the issue.

title.children: Push to reduce red tape to allow for more cultural burning being considered in NSW

image.altText: A holding pen crammed with goats on a clear, sunny day.

items.synopsis: China is stocking up on Australian goat meat, which is now selling for less than $3 a kilogram — down from $9 a year ago. But that's not all farmers are frustrated about.

title.children: China hungry for cheap Australian goat meat, but oversupply leaves sour taste for farmers

image.altText: Jerome Powell stands at a podium behind a wall of American flags.

items.synopsis: The ASX set a 100-day high, after the Federal Reserve hiked interest rates to a 22-year high.

title.children: ASX at five-month high, Fed raises rates as expected, EY staff bullied and overworked — as it happened

image.altText: An african man sitting infront of a white table and microphone with nine men in military uniforms behind him

items.synopsis: Colonel Amadou Abdramane appears in a video saying Niger's defence forces are putting an end to President Mohamed Bazoum's regime.

title.children: Niger soldiers remove president, seize power in coup
